subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Minibox 2 Test----Remember this box? [6 Attachments]
author: Frank Sumption
full_text:
Still works better than many of my boxes.

 F-S

On Sat, Sep 25, 2010 at 2:30 PM, <urkel23@...> wrote:

>
>  [Attachment(s)<https://mail.google.com/mail/?ui=2&view=js&name=main,tlist&ver=PLpFW8mo6ZU.en.&am=!Y-v-bx6-hLCxhZ4C2vD2RvIM-1u6I_ggKFI_CVzYW0-PTv2Kn6GH&fri#12b4a97e414f232b_TopText>from
> urkel23@... included below]
>
>
> Going through some stuff today and came across this box.  Ron from
> paranormalsystems.com only sold a dozen of these and i think 11 came back
> to him.  That project was a disaster from start to finish.  I tried to help,
> but cheap parts were used to build it.
>
> I took it apart today to look and see what i can do to improve it.  The
> first thing i noticed was a crappy antenna, so i swapped it out with one
> from a broken radio sitting here.
>
> Reception did improve, but it still sucks.  It's like polishing a
> turd......Sorry, i know that was disgusting.
>
> This box is AM Random mode only.  I think when you try to get too advanced
> with building these, that's when the problems start.  Simple is the best way
> to do it.  I've attached the raw audio of the test with it and some sample
> files i got.
>
> Now i guess it goes back into the closet where i got it from.
>
> -Steve
>
>
>
>
